  <td width="50%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:50.62%;">

<p style="margin:0pt 44.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 44.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The accompanying
notes to condensed consolidated financial statements are an integral part of
this statement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">2</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 44.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 44.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The accompanying
notes to condensed consolidated financial statements are an integral part of
this statement.</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 1.8pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Abbott
Laboratories and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 1.8pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed
Consolidated Financial Statements</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 1.8pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">June 30, 2006</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 1.8pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 1.8pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 1 &#151; Basis of
Presentation</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 9.9pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The accompanying
unaudited, condensed consolidated financial statements have been prepared
pursuant to rules and regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission
and, therefore, do not include all information and footnote disclosures
normally included in audited financial statements.&#160; However, in the opinion of management, all
adjustments necessary to present fairly the results of operations, financial
position and cash flows have been made.&#160;
It is suggested that these statements be read in conjunction with the
financial statements included in Abbott&#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the
year ended December 31, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 62.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 2 &#151; Supplemental Financial Information</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 62.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 32.4pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The increases in Other
(income) expense, net for the second quarter and six months ended June 30, 2006
are primarily due to fair value adjustments to certain derivative financial
instruments included with the investment in Boston Scientific common stock.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 1.1pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other, net in Net Cash From Operating Activities for
2006 and 2005 includes the effects of contributions to the main domestic
defined benefit plan of $200 million and $641 million, respectively, and to the
post-employment medical and dental plans of $40 million and $140 million,
respectively, and changes in income taxes, primarily income tax payments.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 62.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 14.4pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The cost basis of
the Boston Scientific shares is $1.326 billion, of which $999 million is
classified as available-for-sale securities and $327 million is classified
under the cost method of accounting.&#160; The
fair value of the available-for-sale shares was $737 million at June 30, 2006,
resulting in a charge of $157 million to Accumulated other comprehensive income
(loss), net of income taxes of $105 million.&#160;
The fair value of the shares recorded under the cost method amounted to
$239 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 14.4pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The decline in the
fair value of the Boston Scientific shares, as noted above, is considered by
management to be temporary as these shares have been owned by Abbott for a
relatively short period of time and Abbott has both the ability and intent to
hold the shares for a period of time to allow for the decline in value to
reverse.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">5</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='5',FILE='C:\fc\21916939235_D11189_1283717\14795-1-fi.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  7 16:09 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 3 &#151; Litigation and
Environmental Matters</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Abbott
has been identified as a potentially responsible party for investigation and
cleanup costs at a number of locations in the United States and Puerto Rico
under federal and state remediation laws and is investigating potential
contamination at a number of company-owned locations.&#160; Abbott has recorded an estimated cleanup cost
for each site for which management believes Abbott has a probable loss
exposure.&#160; No individual site cleanup
exposure is expected to exceed $3&nbsp;million, and the aggregate cleanup
exposure is not expected to exceed $15&nbsp;million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">There are two patent
disputes with third parties who claim Abbott&#146;s products infringe their
patents.&#160; In one dispute, Abbott has
agreed to arbitrate and is subject to a minimum amount of damages, which Abbott
has reserved.&#160; In the second dispute,
which Abbott assumed as part of the Guidant acquisition, reserves equal to the
expected resolution have been recorded.</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">There
are several civil actions pending brought by individuals or entities that
allege generally that Abbott and numerous pharmaceutical companies reported
false or misleading pricing information relating to the average wholesale price
of certain pharmaceutical products in connection with federal, state and
private reimbursement.&#160; Civil actions
have also been brought against Abbott, and in some cases other members of the
pharmaceutical industry, by state attorneys general seeking to recover alleged
damages on behalf of state Medicaid programs.&#160;
In May 2006, Abbott was notified that the U.S. Department of Justice
intervened in a civil whistle-blower lawsuit alleging that Abbott inflated
prices for Medicaid and Medicare reimbursable drugs.&#160; The outcome of these investigations and
litigation could include the imposition of fines or penalties.&#160; Abbott is unable to estimate the amount of
possible loss, and no loss reserves have been recorded for these exposures.&#160; Many of the products involved in these cases
are Hospira products.&#160; Abbott retained
liability for losses that result from these cases and investigations to the
extent any such losses both relate to the sale of Hospira&#146;s products prior to
the spin-off of Hospira and relate to allegations that were made in such
pending and future cases and investigations that were the same as allegations
existing at the date of the spin-off.</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Within
the next year, legal proceedings may occur that may result in a change in the
estimated reserves recorded by Abbott.&nbsp; For its legal proceedings and
environmental exposures, excluding the cases and investigations discussed in
the third paragraph of this footnote, Abbott estimates the range of possible
loss to be from approximately $175 million to $370 million.&#160; The recorded reserve balance at June 30, 2006
for these proceedings and exposures was approximately $205 million.&nbsp; The
increase in the reserve and range of possible loss compared to those amounts at
March 31, 2006 is primarily due to loss contingencies acquired with the Guidant
businesses in April 2006.&#160; These reserves
represent management&#146;s best estimate of probable loss, except for one which is
recorded at the minimum, as defined by Statement of Financial Accounting Standards
No.&nbsp;5, &#147;Accounting for Contingencies.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">While it
is not feasible to predict the outcome of all such proceedings and exposures
with certainty, management believes that their ultimate disposition should not
have a material adverse effect on Abbott&#146;s financial position, cash flows, or
results of operations, except for the cases and investigations discussed in the
third paragraph of this footnote, the resolution of which could be material to
cash flows or results of operations for a quarter.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 4 &#151; Comprehensive Income, net of tax </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">(dollars&nbsp;in&nbsp;thousands)</font></i></p>

 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">6</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='6',FILE='C:\fc\21916939235_D11189_1283717\14795-1-fi.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  7 16:09 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 36.0pt .0001pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 5 &#151;
Post-Employment Benefits</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 36.0pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">(dollars
in millions)</font></i></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Retirement
plans consist of defined benefit, defined contribution, and medical and dental
plans.&#160; Net cost for the six months ended
June 30 for Abbott&#146;s major defined benefit plans and post-employment
medical and dental benefit plans is as follows:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="304" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:227.8pt;">
  <p style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableLeft --></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="126" colspan="5" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:94.6pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Defined&nbsp;Benefit&nbsp;Plans</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="126" colspan="5" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:94.6pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Medical&nbsp;and&nbsp;Dental&nbsp;Plans</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">

<p style="color:black;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Abbott
funds its domestic defined benefit plans according to IRS funding
limitations.&#160; In the first quarters of
2006 and 2005, $200 and $641, respectively, was contributed to the main
domestic defined benefit plan and $40 and $140, respectively, was contributed
to the post-employment medical and dental benefit plans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 62.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 6 &#151; Taxes on
Earnings</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Taxes on earnings reflect
the estimated annual effective rates and the effect of discrete tax events that
occurred in the second quarter of 2006.&#160;
For the six months ended June 30, 2006, 6.2 percentage points of tax benefit
was attributed to discrete items, primarily the tax benefit on acquired
in-process and collaborations research and development.&#160; The first six months 2005 includes additional
income tax expense of approximately $52 million for remittances of foreign
earnings of approximately $600 million in connection with the American Jobs
Creation Act of 2004.&#160; The effective tax
rates, excluding the effect of the income taxes on the remittances of foreign
earnings and the discrete items, are less than the statutory U.S. federal income
tax rate principally due to the domestic dividend exclusion and the benefit of
lower statutory tax rates and tax exemptions in several taxing jurisdictions.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 7 &#151; Segment
Information <br>
<i>(dollars in millions)</i></font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt .9pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Revenue
Segments</font></i>&#151; Abbott&#146;s principal business is the discovery,
development, manufacture and sale of a broad line of health care products.&#160; Abbott&#146;s products are generally sold directly
to retailers, wholesalers, hospitals, health care facilities, laboratories,
physicians&#146; offices and government agencies throughout the world.&#160; Effective with the acquisition of Guidant&#146;s
vascular intervention and endovascular solutions businesses on April 21, 2006,
Abbott&#146;s base vascular business and Guidant&#146;s vascular intervention and
endovascular solutions businesses are reported as the Vascular Products
segment.&#160; Effective January 1, 2006,
Abbott&#146;s segments were reorganized to reflect the shift of nutritional products
from Abbott&#146;s International division to a newly formed division, Abbott
Nutrition International.&#160; As a result of
this reorganization, total assets of approximately $850 have been transferred
from the International division to the Abbott Nutrition International Products
division.&#160; For segment reporting
purposes, Abbott&#146;s Ross Products division and the Abbott Nutrition
International division are aggregated and reported as the Nutritional Products
segment and the U.S. and international pharmaceutical products divisions are
aggregated and reported as the Pharmaceutical Products segment.&#160; Abbott&#146;s reportable segments are as follows:</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt .9pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Pharmaceutical
Products</font></i>&#151; Worldwide sales of a broad line of
pharmaceuticals.&#160; For segment reporting
purposes, two pharmaceutical divisions are aggregated and reported as the
Pharmaceutical Products segment.</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">7</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='7',FILE='C:\fc\21916939235_D11189_1283717\14795-1-fi.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  7 16:09 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 17.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Diagnostic
Products</font></i>&#151; Worldwide sales of diagnostic systems and tests for
blood banks, hospitals, consumers, commercial laboratories and alternate-care
testing sites.&#160; For segment reporting
purposes, four diagnostic divisions are aggregated and reported as the
Diagnostic Products segment.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt .9pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Nutritional
Products</font></i>&#151; Worldwide sales of a broad line of adult and
pediatric nutritional products.&#160; For
segment reporting purposes, two nutritional divisions are aggregated and
reported as the Nutritional Products segment.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt .9pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Vascular</font></i>
<i>Products</i>&#151; Worldwide sales of coronary,
endovascular and vessel closure products.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Abbott&#146;s underlying
accounting records are maintained on a legal entity basis for government and
public reporting requirements. &#160;Segment
disclosures are on a performance basis consistent with internal management
reporting.&#160; Intersegment transfers of
inventory are recorded at standard cost and are not a measure of segment
operating earnings.&#160; The cost of some
corporate functions and the cost of certain employee benefits are charged to
segments at predetermined rates that approximate cost.&#160; Remaining costs, if any, are not allocated to
segments<b>.&#160;
</b>For acquisitions prior to 2006, substantially all intangible
assets and related amortization are not allocated to segments.<b>&#160; </b>The
following segment information has been prepared in accordance with the internal
accounting policies of Abbott, as described above, and are not presented in
accordance with generally accepted accounting principles applied to the
consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5,907</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.98%;">

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)&#160;&#160;&#160; The decreases
in Pharmaceutical Product segment sales are due primarily to the effects of the
amendment to the Boehringer Ingelheim distribution agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)&#160;&#160;&#160; The
increase in Vascular Product segment sales is primarily due to the acquisition
of Guidant&#146;s vascular intervention and endovascular solutions businesses on
April 21, 2006.&#160; These results include
approximately ten weeks of domestic sales and only approximately five weeks of
international sales due to Abbott&#146;s policy of recording the results of
international operations on a one-month lag.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)&#160;&#160;&#160; Approximately
40 to 45 percent of the annual cost of share-based awards will typically be
recognized in the first quarter due to the timing of the granting of
share-based awards.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">8</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='8',FILE='C:\fc\21916939235_D11189_1283717\14795-1-fi.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  7 16:09 2006' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>

<p style="margin:0pt .9pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 8 &#151; Business Combination and Related Transactions</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt .9pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In order to expand
Abbott&#146;s presence in the growing vascular market, Abbott acquired Guidant&#146;s
vascular intervention and endovascular solutions businesses for approximately
$4.1 billion, in cash, in connection with Boston Scientific&#146;s acquisition of
Guidant.&#160; These businesses were acquired
on April 21, 2006 and the financial results of the acquired operations are
included in these financial statements beginning on that date.&#160; In addition, Abbott will also pay to Boston
Scientific $250 million each upon government approvals to market the <i>XIENCE</i> drug-eluting stent in the U.S. and
in Japan.&#160; Each $250 million payment will
result in the recording of additional goodwill.&#160;
The preliminary allocation of the acquisition cost is shown in the table
below <i>(in millions of dollars)</i>.&#160; These allocations will be finalized when
appraisals are completed.</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;">
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="534" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:400.7pt;">
  <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableLeft -->Goodwill</p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,807</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="534" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:400.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Acquired
  intangible assets, primarily product rights for <br>
  marketed products, customer relationships and technology</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,249</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="534" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:400.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Acquired
  in-process research and development</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">452</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="534" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:400.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Acquired net
  tangible assets</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">620</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="534" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:400.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total preliminary
  allocation of acquisition cost</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4,128</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt .9pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt .9pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The acquisition
cost has been allocated to the acquired net assets based on preliminary
appraisals of the estimated fair values on the date of acquisition.&#160; Acquired intangible assets are expected to be
amortized over 3 to 14 years (average of approximately 9 years).&#160; Acquired in-process research and development
was charged to income in the second quarter of 2006.&#160; The net tangible assets acquired consist
primarily of property and equipment of approximately $540 million, trade
accounts receivable of approximately $250 million and inventories of
approximately $120 million, net of assumed liabilities, primarily trade
accounts payable, litigation reserves and other liabilities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt .9pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In order to
facilitate Boston Scientific&#146;s acquisition of Guidant, Abbott also acquired
64.6 million shares of Boston Scientific common stock directly from Boston
Scientific and loaned $900 million to a wholly-owned subsidiary of Boston
Scientific.&#160; Abbott is required to
dispose of the shares by October 2008.&#160;
Unless the shares trade above an average of $30 per share for twenty
consecutive trading days, Abbott cannot dispose of any shares until October
2006.&#160; Sales of the shares are limited to
approximately 5.4 million shares per month until October 2007.&#160; The amount recorded upon the acquisition of
the shares includes a discount to market, based on an appraisal, to reflect the
value of the restrictions on sale.&#160; On
the date of acquisition, half of the shares were recorded as available for sale
in accordance with SFAS No. 115 and the remainder under the cost method in
accordance with APB No. 18. <b>&#160;</b>The loan, which is due in April
2011, is guaranteed by Boston Scientific and bears a favorable effective
interest rate of 4 percent, which is reflected in the valuation of the note
receivable.&#160; In connection with the acquisition
of the shares, Boston Scientific is entitled to certain after-tax gains upon
Abbott&#146;s sale of the shares.&#160; Abbott
would retain any gains on the sale of the Boston Scientific shares up to a
sales price of $23.83; Boston Scientific would receive any after-tax gains on
the sale of the shares for the portion of the sales price in excess of&#160; $23.83 but lower than $26.00; and Boston
Scientific would receive one-half of any after-tax gain for the portion of the
sales price in excess of $25.99.&#160; Based
on an appraisal, Abbott recorded approximately $114 million for this
gain-sharing derivative financial instrument liability.<b> </b>&#160;In
addition, Boston Scientific agreed to reimburse Abbott for certain borrowing
costs on debt incurred to acquire the Boston Scientific shares.&#160; After Abbott incurs the first $10 million of
interest expense on debt incurred to acquire the shares, Boston Scientific will
reimburse Abbott for the next $60 million of interest expense.&#160; Reimbursement for the incremental interest
expense will be in the form of additional common stock of Boston Scientific,
payable 18 months after the acquisition.&#160;
Abbott recorded approximately $55 million for this interest derivative
financial instrument asset.&#160; The effect
of recording the shares, the loan to Boston Scientific and the derivative financial
instruments at fair value on the date of acquisition resulted in the recording
of additional goodwill of approximately $204 million.&#160; The financial assets and liability acquired
from Boston Scientific were valued and recorded at acquisition as follows <i>(in millions of dollars)</i>:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 45.0pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">9</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='9',FILE='C:\fc\2161675605_D11055_1277418\14795-1-fk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 16:07 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 9 &#151; Incentive Stock
Programs</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 1.45pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">In the first six months of 2006,
Abbott granted 23,587,971 stock options, 1,842,056 replacement stock options,
1,047,100 (net of forfeitures of 100,000 shares) restricted stock awards and
674,797 (net of forfeitures of 11,100 shares) restricted stock units under the
programs.&#160; The purchase price of shares
under option must be at least equal to the fair market value of the common
stock on the date of grant, and the maximum term of an option is
10&nbsp;years.&#160; Options granted in 2006
vest equally over three years except for replacement options, which vest in six
months.&#160; Most options granted before
January 1, 2005 included a replacement feature.&#160;
When an employee tenders mature shares to Abbott upon exercise of a
stock option, a replacement stock option is granted equal to the amount of
shares tendered.&#160; Replacement options are
granted at the then current market price for a term that expires on the date of
the underlying option grant.&#160; Upon a
change in control of Abbott, all outstanding stock options become fully
exercisable, and all terms and conditions of all restricted stock awards are
deemed satisfied.&#160; </font><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b style="font-weight:normal;">Restricted stock awards granted in 2006 have a 5
year term, with no more than one-third of the award vesting in any one year
upon Abbott reaching a minimum return on equity target.&#160; Restricted stock units granted in 2006 vest
over three years and upon vesting, the recipient receives one share of Abbott
stock for each vested restricted stock unit.&#160;
</b></font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Restricted stock
awards and settlement of vested restricted stock units are issued out of
treasury shares.&#160; Abbott issues new
shares for exercises of stock options.&#160;
Abbott does not have a policy of purchasing its shares relating to its
share-based programs.</font>&#160; <font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">At June 30, 2006, approximately 26&nbsp;million
shares were reserved for future grants.</font></font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The number of restricted stock awards and units
outstanding and their weighted-average grant-date fair value at January 1, 2006
and June 30, 2006 was 2,381,800 ($50.09) and 3,680,245 ($45.41),
respectively.&#160; The number of restricted
stock awards and units, and their weighted-average grant-date fair value,
granted, vested and lapsed during the six months ended June 30, 2006 were
1,832,997 ($43.95), 415,452 ($49.95) and 119,100 ($44.03), respectively.&#160; The fair value of restricted stock awards and
units vested in the six months ended June 30, 2006 and 2005 was $24,941,000 and
$6,691,000, respectively.</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.08%;">

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.4</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

</table>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The aggregate intrinsic value of options
outstanding and exercisable at June 30, 2006 was $387 million and $367 million,
respectively.&#160; The total unrecognized
compensation cost related to all share-based compensation plans at June 30,
2006 amounted to approximately $303 million and is expected to be recognized
over the next three years.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">On January 1, 2006, </font>Abbott adopted the provisions of Statement of
Financial Accounting Standards No. 123 (revised 2004), &#147;Share-Based Payment,&#148;
which requires that the fair value of share-based awards be recorded in the
results of operations.&#160; Abbott used the
modified prospective method of adoption.&#160;
Under this method, prior years&#146; financial results do not include the
impact of recording stock options using fair value.&#160; Under the revised standard, awards issued
after 2005 and the remainder of any unrecognized cost for grants issued prior
to 2006 are charged to expense.&#160; <font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Total non-cash compensation expense charged
against income in the second quarter and first six months of 2006 for
share-based plans totaled approximately $65 million and $211 million,
respectively, and the tax benefit recognized was approximately $15 million and
$50 million, respectively.&#160; </font>Approximately
40 to 45 percent of the annual net cost of share-based awards will typically be
recognized in the first quarter due to the timing of the granting of
share-based awards.&#160; <font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Compensation cost capitalized as part of inventory
is not significant.&#160; Through December 31,
2005, Abbott measured compensation cost using the intrinsic value-based
method of accounting for stock options and replacement options granted to
employees</font>.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">10</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='10',FILE='C:\fc\2161675605_D11055_1277418\14795-1-fk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 16:07 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Had compensation cost been determined using the fair value-based
accounting method in 2005, pro forma net income (<i>in millions</i>) and earnings per share (EPS) amounts would have
been as follows:</font></p>

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="60" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:45.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">877</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="60" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:45.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,715</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="422" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:316.3pt;">

  net of taxes of $21 and $47, respectively</font></p>

<p style="line-height:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="line-height:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The weighted average fair value of an option granted in 2006 and 2005
was $11.72 and $12.17, respectively.&#160; The
fair value of an option grant was estimated using the Black-Scholes
option-pricing model with the following assumptions:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="501" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:376.0pt;">
  <p style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableLeft --></p>
  </td>
  <td width="20" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:15.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2006</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2005</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="501" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:376.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Risk-free
  interest rate</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="20" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:15.0pt;">

  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">

  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">

 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="501" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:376.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="20" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:15.0pt;">

  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">

  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">

 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="501" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:376.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Volatility</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="20" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:15.0pt;">

  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">

  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">

  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="501" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:376.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Dividend yield</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="20" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:15.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.7</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.2</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt .9pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The risk-free interest rate is based on the rates
available at the time of the grant for zero-coupon U.S. government issues with
a remaining term equal to the option&#146;s expected life.&#160; The average life of an option granted in 2006
is based on both historical and projected exercise and lapsing data.&#160; Prior to 2006, the average life of an option
granted was based on historical experience.&#160;
Expected volatility for 2006 option grants is based on implied
volatilities from traded options on Abbott&#146;s stock and historical volatility of
Abbott&#146;s stock over the expected life of the option.&#160; Expected volatility for options granted prior
to 2006 was based on historical volatility over a period prior to the option
grant equal to the option&#146;s expected life.&#160;&#160;
Dividend yield is based on the option&#146;s exercise price and annual
dividend rate at the time of grant.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 10 &#151; Equity Method
Investment<br>
<i>(dollars in millions)</i></font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0pt 17.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Abbott&#146;s 50 percent-owned joint
venture, TAP Pharmaceutical Products&nbsp;Inc. (TAP), is accounted for under
the equity method of accounting.&#160;
Summarized financial information for TAP is as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">11</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='11',FILE='C:\fc\2161675605_D11055_1277418\14795-1-fk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 16:07 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note&nbsp;11&nbsp;&#151;
Goodwill and Intangible Assets<br>
<i style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(dollars
in millions)</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Abbott recorded total goodwill of approximately $2,011
related to the acquisition of </font>Guidant&#146;s vascular intervention and
endovascular solutions businesses<font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> in the
second quarter of 2006.&#160; Foreign currency
translation adjustments and other adjustments increased (decreased) goodwill in
the first six months of 2006 and 2005 by approximately $394 and $(232),
respectively.&#160; There were no reductions
of goodwill relating to impairments or disposal of all or a portion of a
business.</font></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
gross amount of amortizable intangible assets, primarily product rights and
technology, was $8,184 as of June 30, 2006 and $6,776 as of December&nbsp;31,
2005, and accumulated amortization was $2,306 as of June 30, 2006 and $2,053 as
of December 31, 2005.&#160; Intangible assets
with indefinite lives are not significant.&#160;
<font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The estimated annual amortization
expense for intangible assets is $589<b> </b>in
2006, $635 in 2007, $622 in 2008, $621 in 2009, and $623 in 2010.&#160;&#160; These amounts include the estimated
amortization of intangible assets acquired in 2006 and are subject to change
when appraisals are completed.&#160;
Intangible assets are expected to be amortized over 3 to 25&nbsp;years
(average 12&nbsp;years).</font></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 36.0pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 12 &#151;
Restructuring Plans</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2005, Abbott
management approved plans to realign its global manufacturing operations and
selected international commercial operations.&#160;
An additional $22 million<b> </b>was
subsequently recorded in the first six months of 2006 relating to these
restructurings, primarily for accelerated depreciation.&#160; The following summarizes the activity for
restructurings <i>(dollars in millions)</i>:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="359" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:269.45pt;">
  <p style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableLeft --></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="60" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:45.15pt;">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 36.0pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">FINANCIAL REVIEW</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 36.0pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Results of
Operations</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 36.0pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following
table details sales by reportable segment for the second quarter and first six
months:<br>
<i>(dollars in millions)</i></font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="18%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:18.26%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="38%" colspan="9" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:38.28%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Three&nbsp;Months&nbsp;Ended&nbsp;June&nbsp;30</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.96%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="38%" colspan="9" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:38.28%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Six&nbsp;Months&nbsp;Ended&nbsp;June&nbsp;30</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.82%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.54%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10.1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.96%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:.98%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.54%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5,252</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:.98%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.54%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4,913</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.54%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6.9</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.54%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6.9</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)&#160;&#160;&#160; Percentage changes are versus the prior year
and are based on unrounded numbers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)&#160;&#160;&#160; The Pharmaceutical Products segment has an
agreement with Boehringer Ingelheim (BI) to co-promote and distribute three of
its products in the U.S. In 2005, Abbott and BI amended the agreement.&#160; Effective January&nbsp;1, 2006, Abbott no
longer distributes or records sales for distribution activities for the BI
products.&#160; Abbott continued to co-promote
one product, <i>Micardis</i>, through
March&nbsp;31, 2006, and receives residual commissions on BI&#146;s sales of the
products.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt .9pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Worldwide sales
for the second quarter and six months 2006 compared to 2005, excluding sales of
BI products, reflect primarily unit growth and the acquisition of Guidant&#146;s
vascular intervention and endovascular solutions businesses on April 21, 2006
and are partially offset by the negative effect of the relatively stronger U.S.
dollar.&#160; The acquired businesses
accounted for increases in sales of 268 percent and 142 percent in the Vascular
Products segment and 3.0 percent and 1.5 percent in total net sales for the
second quarter and six months ended June 30, 2006, respectively.&#160; The results from this acquisition include
approximately ten weeks of domestic sales and only approximately five weeks of
international sales due to Abbott&#146;s policy of recording the results of
international operations on a one-month lag.&#160;&#160;
The relatively stronger U.S. dollar decreased second quarter and first
six months 2006 consolidated net sales 0.9 percent and 1.8 percent,
respectively, and decreased Total International sales 2.0 percent and 3.9
percent, respectively, over the second quarter and first six months of 2005.&#160; In addition, the effect of the relatively
stronger U.S. dollar decreased second quarter and first six months 2006 sales
in the Diagnostic Products segment by 1.7 percent and 3.0 percent,
respectively, and sales in the Pharmaceutical Products segment by 0.9 percent
and 1.9 percent, respectively.&#160; Sales for
the Nutritional Products segment were favorably impacted in 2006 by increased
sales volume of international pediatric products and by incremental revenue
from a revised agreement for the U.S. promotion of <i>Synagis</i>.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">13</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='13',FILE='C:\fc\21917134341_D11189_1283920\14795-1-fm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  7 17:01 2006' -->

 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>

the six months ended June 30 is as follows: <i>(dollars
in millions)</i></font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="51" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:38.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="319" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:239.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Nutritionals &#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="51" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:38.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="51" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:38.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6.2</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="51" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:38.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">349</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="51" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:38.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11.0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

 <tr height="0">
  <td width="319" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="45" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="51" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="45" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="51" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="6" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 44.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a) Percentage
changes are versus the prior year and are based on unrounded numbers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt .9pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Increased sales volume of <i>Humira </i>and<i> Tricor </i>in 2006 favorably impacted U.S.
Pharmaceutical Operations.&#160; These
increases were partially offset by lower U.S. sales of <i>Biaxin </i>due to generic competition for the
immediate-release formulation as well as a weaker flu season.&#160; U.S. sales of <i>Biaxin </i>were
$80 million and $173 million in the first six months of 2006 and 2005,
respectively.&#160; U.S. Specialty Operations
were favorably impacted by increased sales volume and price for <i>Depakote and Kaletra. </i>&#160;Decreased sales volume due to generic
competition for <i>clarithromycin</i> unfavorably
impacted International Anti-Infectives.&#160;
Immunochemistry sales for 2006 were negatively affected 3.5 percent by
the relatively stronger U.S. dollar. <i>&#160;</i>Diabetes Care product sales growth
in 2005 was favorably impacted by the acquisition of TheraSense in the second
quarter of 2004.&#160; The decrease in sales
of U.S. pediatric nutritionals in the Nutritional Products segment in 2006 was
due to competitive share loss and the decrease in sales of U.S. pediatric
nutritionals in 2005 was primarily due to overall infant nutritionals non-WIC
category decline and competitive share loss.&#160;
International Pediatric Nutritionals sales increased due primarily to
volume growth in developing countries.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt .9pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">On January 1, 2006, </font>Abbott adopted the provisions of Statement of
Financial Accounting Standards No. 123 (revised 2004), &#147;Share-Based Payment,&#148;
which requires that the fair value of share-based awards be recorded in the
results of operations.&#160; Abbott used the
modified prospective method of adoption.&#160;
Under this method, prior years&#146; financial results do not include the
impact of recording stock options using fair value.&#160; <font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Total
non-cash compensation expense charged against income in the first six months of
2006 for share-based plans totaled approximately $211 million.&#160; </font>Approximately 40 to 45 percent of the
annual net cost of share-based awards will typically be recognized in the first
quarter due to the timing of the grants of share-based awards.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt .9pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The gross profit
margin was 56.6 percent for the
second quarter 2006, compared to 52.4 percent for the second quarter 2005.&#160; First six months 2006 gross profit margin was
57.3 percent, compared to 52.7 percent for the first six months 2005.&#160; The increases in the gross profit margins
were due to favorable product mix, primarily as a result of decreased sales of
Boehringer Ingelheim products that have lower margins than for other products
in the Pharmaceutical Products segment.&#160;
These increases were partially offset by higher intangible asset
amortization and other acquisition related costs associated with the
acquisition of Guidant&#146;s vascular intervention and endovascular solutions
businesses.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 1.1pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Research and development expenses increased 24.9 percent in the second quarter
2006 and 18.1 percent for the
first six months 2006 over comparable 2005 periods.&#160;&#160; The increases are due to the acquisition of
Guidant&#146;s vascular intervention and endovascular solutions businesses, the
effect of recording compensation expense relating to share-based awards and
increased spending to support pipeline programs, including follow-on
indications for <i>Humira</i>, and<i> </i>other
late-stage clinical programs in pharmaceuticals, diabetes care and
vascular.&#160; The majority of
research and development expenditures are concentrated on pharmaceutical
products<b>.</b></font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">14</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='14',FILE='C:\fc\21917134341_D11189_1283920\14795-1-fm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  7 17:01 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt .9pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Selling, general
and administrative expenses for the second quarter and first six months 2006
increased 12.5 percent and 13.1 percent, respectively, over the
comparable 2005 periods.&#160; Both 2006
periods include the effect of recording compensation expense relating to
share-based awards and the acquisition of Guidant&#146;s vascular intervention and
endovascular solutions businesses.&#160; These
items increased selling, general and administrative expenses by 6.1 percentage
points and 7.1 percentage points over the second quarter and first six months
of 2005.&#160;&#160; The remaining increases were
due, in part, to increased selling and marketing support for new and existing
products, including continued spending for <i>Humira</i>,
as well as spending on other marketed pharmaceutical products.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 44.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net interest
expense</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt .9pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net interest
expense increased in both the second quarter and first six months of 2006 due
to higher interest rates and higher borrowings as a result of the acquisition of
Guidant&#146;s vascular intervention and endovascular solutions businesses, and
Abbott&#146;s investments in the common stock of Boston Scientific and the note
receivable; partially offset by higher interest income.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other (income) expense,
net</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 32.4pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The increases in Other
(income) expense, net for the second quarter and six months ended June 30, 2006
are primarily due to fair value adjustments to certain derivative financial
instruments included with the investment in Boston Scientific common stock.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 22.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Taxes on Earnings</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Taxes on earnings reflect
the estimated annual effective rates and the effect of discrete tax events that
occurred in the second quarter of 2006.&#160;
For the six months ended June 30, 2006, 6.2 percentage points of tax benefit
was attributed to discrete items, primarily the tax benefit on acquired
in-process and collaborations research and development.&#160; The first six months 2005 includes additional
income tax expense of approximately $52 million for remittances of foreign earnings
of approximately $600 million in connection with the American Jobs Creation Act
of 2004.&#160; The effect of the increased
income taxes on the remittance of foreign earnings was to increase the first
six months 2005 effective tax rate by approximately 2.2 percentage points.&#160; Abbott estimates that the effective tax rate
for the last six months of 2006 will be between 23.5 percent and 24.0
percent.&#160; The effective tax rates,
excluding the effect of the income taxes on the remittances of foreign earnings
and discrete items, are less than the statutory U.S. federal income tax rate
principally due to the domestic dividend exclusion and the benefit of lower
statutory tax rates and tax exemptions in several taxing jurisdictions.</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">TAP Pharmaceutical Products Inc. Joint Venture</font></u></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In August 2006,
TAP Pharmaceutical Products Inc. received an approvable letter from the U.S.
Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for the investigational compound febuxostat
for the management of hyperuricemia in patients with gout.&#160; TAP intends to discuss with the FDA next
steps for pursuing approval for febuxostat.&#160;
This approvable letter has no impact on Abbott&#146;s previously stated
earnings per share guidance for 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt .9pt 12.0pt 0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Restructurings</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2005, Abbott
management approved plans to realign its global manufacturing operations and
selected international commercial operations.&#160;
An additional $22 million<b> </b>was
subsequently recorded in the first six months of 2006 relating to these
restructurings, primarily for accelerated depreciation.&#160; The following summarizes the activity for
restructurings <i>(dollars in millions)</i>:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;">
